Class NoSQLInjectionInSpringBoot

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.fraunhofer.iem.secucheck.InternalFluentTQL.catalog.NoSQLInjection.CWE943.NoSQLInjectionInSpringBoot
  • @Controller
@RequestMapping("/webAPP")
public class NoSQLInjectionInSpringBoot
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains the No-SQL-Injection example in spring boot.

      NoSQLInjectionInSpringBoot()  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> getMyInformation​(java.lang.String empID)
      Returns the information of the employee id requested by the user without any safe, this method contains No-SQL-Injection vulnerability.
      org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> getMyInformationSafely​(java.lang.String empID)
      Returns the information of the employee id requested by the user with safe, this method avoids No-SQL-Injection vulnerability.
      java.lang.String index()
      Simple index page of the Spring boot application.
      java.lang.String sanitizeForMongoDB​(java.lang.String empID)
      This is the simple user defined sanitizer to sanitize the user input for the MongoDB.

                method=POST)
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> getMyInformation​(@RequestParam(defaultValue="")
                                                                                  java.lang.String empID)
        Returns the information of the employee id requested by the user without any safe, this method contains No-SQL-Injection vulnerability.

        Returns:

      • sanitizeForMongoDB

        public java.lang.String sanitizeForMongoDB​(java.lang.String empID)
        This is the simple user defined sanitizer to sanitize the user input for the MongoDB. This is not recommended to use this as a sanitizer, this is used here as an example.
        Parameters:
        empID - Employee ID
        Returns:
        Sanitized employee id.
